reviews.review_msg: Dr. Lee is a great prof for upper-div HSCI courses. His classes are very focused on application/analysis skills which I found to be very helpful! However, all the papers you write are 20+ pages.

This guy makes the labs bearable. He's incredibly relaxed and likes to joke and have a good time. His marking is reasonable, just make sure not to leave your lab reports to the last minute. Overall, he is one of the better lab professors I have had and would recommend him to anyone!

Very willing to help. Lab manual could be slightly clearer, but a lecture along with the lab could be helpful. Lots of self research was required. Average was fairly decent and Frank is a fair marker for the most part. He does not have much of a liking for personal flavour/style. Keep it simple.
He was very knowledgeable and funny in our labs and his feedback was great. My favourite undergrad prof and course.

99% of his job is done by the TA. Most of the time, students gather around the TA and wait for answers and help while the instructor is staring and frowning with flushing face. The class might have been more efficient if the instructor had taken some of the students' inquiries.

Best Prof ever! He cares about understanding over merely correct results.  Exceptionally caring and supportive, providing detailed feedback for papers that help us to improve. The lab sessions are enjoyable and have a great vibe. This is my second course with him, I highly recommend taking HSCI440 and even other courses with him.
